data.title: Why Shares of Tesla Plunged 21.6% in March
data.text: Most of Tesla's operations are closed, and that's bad for any business.

data.title: Tesla engineers are building ventilators for coronavirus patients out of car parts—take a look
data.text: Engineers at electric automaker Tesla are working to address the shortage of much-needed ventilators in American hospitals facing an influx of COVID-19 cases. "We're trying to make some ventilators out of some car parts, so that we can help out the medical industry without taking away from their supply," a Tesla engineer says.

data.title: Stock Market Today: Major Indices Roar Back to Life; Buy Tesla?
data.text: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon gave his thoughts on the current pandemic, as Immunomedics shares double. Here's the stock market today.

data.title: Mt. Sinai COO Says Donated B-PAP Machines From Tesla Are Being Converted Into Ventilators
data.text: The President of Mount Sinia says a team at the hospital has designed a conversion kit that makes breathing assistance machines donated by Tesla CEO Elon Musk into desperately needed ventilators that can used on critical care patients suffering from COVID-19.

data.title: Tesla reveals prototype ventilator made from electric vehicle parts
data.text: Tesla engineers posted a YouTube video explaining the company's prototype ventilator for coronavirus patients.

data.title: Tesla's working on making ventilators from car parts
data.text: Tesla engineers are working on a ventilator made largely from car parts, according to a YouTube video the automaker posted on Sunday.

data.title: 3 Car Stocks to Buy to Drive Profits Back After the Coronavirus Pit Stop
data.text: Car stocks have been to the brink before, so they will survive this test as well. Fans of GM, Ford and Tesla stocks shouldn't give up on them.

data.title: Tesla Reveals a Ventilator Built With Model 3 Parts
data.text: Forget finding ventilators -- Tesla decided to simply build its own.

data.title: Why Tesla Stock  Jumped Monday
data.text: One analyst thinks shares could surge to $800.

data.title: Here's how Tesla stock swings 18% higher, trader says
data.text: Tesla opened strongly higher Monday. The stock was up more than 5% at midmorning after Jefferies upgraded it to buy on the company's leadership in the electric-vehicle market.

data.title: Jefferies Upgrades Tesla, Says Company Is 'Doubling Market Coverage With Model Y'
data.text: Electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) converted another one of its Wall Street skeptics on Monday.

data.title: Tesla stock gets an upgrade at Jefferies
data.text: Jefferies analyst Philippe Houchois upgraded Tesla Inc.'s stock TSLA, +5.62% to buy from hold on Monday, writing that while low gas prices could be a headwind to customer demand in the near term, he's encouraged by "continued public policy commitment to supporting [electric-vehicle] sales" in Europe and China.

data.title: Tesla (TSLA) Q1 Deliveries Impress Despite Coronavirus Crisis
data.text: Tesla's (TSLA) Model S/X division records production and delivery volume of 15,390 and 12,200 vehicles, respectively, in Q1.

data.title: Tesla shows off its COVID-19 ventilator made from Model 3 parts
data.text:
Tesla says it’s sourcing Model 3 parts because they know the components “really well” and trust their reliability.
Health systems around the world are in dire need of ventilators to help treat the most critical COVID-19 patients.

data.title: Tesla stock is not reflecting impact on demand of a global recession, Baird analyst says
data.text: Tesla Inc.'s stock TSLA, +5.62% has not priced in the impact on demand of a global recession, which could hurt its business for several quarters or longer, Baird analyst Ben Kallo wrote Monday.

data.title: Tesla Shows 'Car Parts-Based' Ventilator Prototype For Coronavirus Pandemic
data.text: Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) on Sunday publicized a prototype of its ventilators for patients who fall critically ill from novel coronavirus (COVID-19).

data.title: Tesla Touts A Prototype Ventilator For COVID-19 Patients Made Out Of Electric Car Parts
data.text: The coronavirus crisis has led Elon Musk to take an unexpected jump into the medical device industry.
